name: SABELLA
membership: Pôle Mer Bretagne Atlantique, Initiative PArtenariale Nationale pour l'émergence des Énergies MArines, Syndicat des Énergies Renouvelables, Bretagne Pôle Naval, France Énergies Marines, Cluster Maritime Français, Australian Ocean Energy Group, Ocean Energy Europe, French Renewable Energy Group in Indonesia
goal: Founded in 2008, SABELLA is an innovative tidal and ocean streams turbines developer, supplying reliable turnkey energy solutions worldwide. After the successful immersion of the D03 prototype in 2008, SABELLA stands out with the completion of its demonstration project in Ushant, Sabella D10 being the  first tidal stream turbine immersed and grid-connected to the French national grid. With a differentiated and economically-optimized range of technologies, protected by appropriated patents, SABELLA endeavors to promote a new energetic model tailored for remote grids on islands and isolated shore communities. Based on a clean and reliable resource, the model offered by SABELLA to these markets is a sustainable alternative to costly and polluting fuel-based power generation.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Energy, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
Applied and awarded several EU financing program: MARINET, MARINET2, INTERREG ICE, H2020 RealTide and INTERREG MONITOR, DTOCean+
Interest in initiatives for islands.
